Class PharmacistView

java.lang.Object
views.PharmacistView
public class PharmacistView extends Object
Class representing the pharmacist view in the hospital management system. This class provides methods for the pharmacist to interact with the system, including managing prescriptions, updating medication inventory, and submitting replenishment requests.

    Constructs a PharmacistView object.

  • Constructor Details

    • PharmacistView

      public PharmacistView()
      Constructs a PharmacistView object. Initializes the scanner for user input.

  • Method Details

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu()
      Displays the pharmacist menu. This menu allows the pharmacist to select options for viewing appointment outcomes, updating prescription statuses, managing medication inventory, and submitting replenishment requests.

    • getUserChoice

      public int getUserChoice()
      Gets the user's menu choice. Prompts the user to enter their choice and returns the selected option as an integer.
      Returns:
      The user's choice as an integer.

    • displayPrescriptions

      public void displayPrescriptions(List<Prescription> prescriptions)
      Displays a list of prescriptions. This method displays the medication name, quantity, and status for each prescription.
      Parameters:
      prescriptions - The list of prescriptions to display.

    • getMedicationNameInput

      public String getMedicationNameInput()
      Gets the medication name input from the user. Prompts the user to enter the medication name and returns the input.
      Returns:
      The medication name as a string.

    • displayInventory

      public void displayInventory(List<InventoryItem> inventory)
      Displays the medication inventory. This method shows the medication name, stock level, and low stock alert level for each inventory item.
      Parameters:
      inventory - The list of inventory items to display.

    • getQuantityInput

      public int getQuantityInput()
      Gets the quantity input from the user. Prompts the user to enter the quantity for prescriptions or replenishment requests.
      Returns:
      The quantity as an integer.

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage(String message)
      Displays a message to the user. Prints a specified message to the console.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to display.

    • getAppointmentIDInput

      public String getAppointmentIDInput()
      Gets the appointment ID input from the user. Prompts the user to enter an appointment ID to dispense medication.
      Returns:
      The appointment ID as a string.
